report_title: Big Hat Group Weekly Security Update Report
report_description: The Weekly Security Update Report is provided by Big Hat Group with the goal of making it easier to find the information System Administrators and Security Professionals need to keep their systems secure. The CVE Weekly Report is provided as a beta resource.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-21337 Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by an elevation of privilege vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21337. This vulnerability has a base score of 5.2/10 and a temporal score of 4.5/10 according to the CVSS 3.1 metrics. The attack vector is local, requiring user interaction, and the attack complexity is high. Successful exploitation could lead to a browser sandbox escape, with potential minor impact on confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Microsoft has released security updates for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) versions 120.0.2210.133, 120.0.2210.160, and 120.0.6099.216/217 to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply these updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The vulnerability is not directly exploitable and would require an attacker to combine it with other vulnerabilities to perform an attack. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Response Center page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20721 Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2024-20721 Improper Input Validation Denial of Service Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-20721, originally in Adobe Software consumed by Microsoft Edge. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build number 120.0.2210.133 is no longer vulnerable. The vulnerability could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code remotely. Microsoft has addressed this vulnerability by releasing the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build number 120.0.2210.133, which mitigates the risk of exploitation. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to ensure protection against this vulnerability. No specific workaround or mitigation beyond updating to the latest version is provided. For further details, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20709 Adobe Systems Incorporated: CVE-2024-20709 Javascript Implementation PDF Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by the CVE-2024-20709, a low severity JavaScript implementation PDF vulnerability assigned by Adobe Systems Incorporated. This vulnerability is addressed by ingesting Chromium, and the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. The vulnerability is in Adobe Software, which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 120.0.2210.133. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20675 Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-20675. The vulnerability has a low severity with a CVSS score of 6.3/5.5. It requires user interaction, where a user needs to click on a specially crafted URL to be compromised by the attacker. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could lead to minor loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The attacker would be able to bypass the protection in Edge that prevents a potentially dangerous extension from being downloaded or updated. Microsoft has released a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 120.0.2210.133, addressing this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Support Lifecycle.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20674 Windows Kerberos Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Windows systems are affected by a Critical Security Feature Bypass vulnerability (CVE-2024-20674) in the Kerberos authentication. The vulnerability has a CVSS base score of 8.8 and a temporal score of 7.7, indicating a high severity. It allows an attacker to bypass the authentication feature, enabling impersonation, and requires user interaction to be exploited. An attacker could convince a user to connect to a malicious server, compromising the protocol. The impact includes high confidentiality, integrity, and availability loss. Microsoft has provided official fixes for various affected Windows versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10, through security updates with build numbers 5034171, 5034184, 5034169, and others. System administrators are advised to apply the provided security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Support Lifecycle.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2024-0333 Insufficient data validation in Extensions
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by CVE-2024-0333, an Insufficient data validation vulnerability in Extensions. This vulnerability was assigned by Chrome and is addressed by ingesting Chromium. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build number 120.0.2210.133 is no longer vulnerable. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 120.0.2210.133. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2023-24023 Mitre: CVE-2023-24023 Bluetooth Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft has addressed the CVE-2023-24023 Bluetooth vulnerability, impacting Windows 10, 11, and Server 2019/2022. The vulnerability allows spoofing attacks and is related to the use of BR/EDR Secure Connections. Microsoft released a software update enforcing the use of specific encryption and authentication algorithms for Bluetooth pairings that have used BR/EDR Secure Connections. This update aims to mitigate the vulnerability by ensuring the use of secure connections for subsequent Bluetooth pairings. It is crucial to note that the new BR/EDR Secure Connections algorithms will only be utilized if both the local system and the remote paired device support BR/EDR Secure Connections. Additionally, increasing the minimum encryption key size, as per Windows guidance, is advised to enhance security. The exploitability assessment indicates that the vulnerability is less likely to be exploited. System administrators are urged to apply the security updates for the affected Windows versions to safeguard against potential spoofing attacks. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Updates page.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2024-0519 Out of bounds memory access in V8
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by CVE-2024-0519, an out of bounds memory access vulnerability in V8, assigned by Chrome. This vulnerability is addressed by ingesting Chromium, and the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code. Google is aware of reports of an exploit for this CVE existing in the wild. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 120.0.2210.144. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024) page.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2024-0518 Type Confusion in V8
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a type confusion vulnerability in V8, identified as CVE-2024-0518, assigned by Chrome. This vulnerability is in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has addressed this vulnerability by ingesting Chromium, and the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. System administrators are advised to ensure that their Microsoft Edge installations are updated to the latest version. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page. Microsoft recognizes the efforts of the security community in coordinated vulnerability disclosure. The latest stable version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the fix is 120.0.2210.144, released on 17-01-2024.

section_1_data.title: Chromium: CVE-2024-0517 Out of bounds write in V8
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by an out of bounds write vulnerability in V8, identified as CVE-2024-0517. This vulnerability was assigned by Chrome and is addressed by ingesting Chromium. The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build number 120.0.2210.144 is no longer vulnerable. The vulnerability is caused by a flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 120.0.2210.144. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20666 BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: The post provides updated FAQ information for the BitLocker Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-20666. This is an informational change only, indicating no substantive updates beyond the previous revision. System administrators are advised to review the updated FAQ for any additional technical details or links for further research.

section_1_data.title: CVE-2024-20658 Microsoft Virtual Hard Disk Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
section_1_data.summary: Microsoft Virtual Hard Disk is impacted by an elevation of privilege vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-20658 with a CVSS score of 7.8. The vulnerability allows an attacker to gain SYSTEM privileges, potentially leading to a complete loss of integrity and availability. The attack vector is local, with low complexity and no user interaction required. Microsoft has provided security updates for various Windows versions, including Windows Server and Windows 10, addressing the elevation of privilege vulnerability. System administrators are advised to apply the relevant security updates to mitigate the risk of exploitation. The availability of an official fix reduces the urgency of remediation, and no specific workaround or mitigation is mentioned. The post is an informational change only, providing updated FAQ information without substantive changes beyond the previous revision.
